page.title: 18Sinclair C5
page.content: The Sinclair C5 was designed in 1981 by Sir Clive Sinclair. The tricycle is driven by a small electric motor, powered by a 12 volt battery giving a maximum speed of 18 m.p.h. for a distance of 20 miles on one charge of the battery. A second battery doubles the range. When it was designed the plastic body of the Sinclair C5 was the largest mass produced injection moulding manufatured. The Sinclair C5 has a high intensity rear light and a head- lamp mounted in the bodywork. A drum brake is fitted on one rear wheel and a caliper brake on the front wheel similar to a normal normal bicycle. The brakes are operated by levers on the handlebars, one of which may be locked to act as a parking brake.
